intro: Alsine kotschyana, commonly known as Kotschyan's sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to harsh, dry climates.
